question: Is your bank offering any Current Deposit account?
answer: Current Deposit Account is specially designed for customers with regular banking transactional needs and do not need Profit.

question: What are the main features of Current Deposit Account?
answer: Offered in LCY (PKR) & FCY (USD, GBP, EUR, JPY & AED), Minimum Account Opening Deposit of Rs.5,000 for LCY, US $500 or equivalent for FCY, No Minimum Monthly Balance Requirement, Debit Card for PKR Account, No limits on monthly credits and debits

question: What are the free services offered with Current Deposit Account?
answer: Free SMS alerts facility on Digital Transactions, Free E-statement & I-Net Banking, Free Inter Branch Online Cash Deposit/Withdrawal (Online), Frequent Transaction and Funds Accessibility

question: What is the target market for Current Deposit Account?
answer: Individuals (either singly or jointly), Proprietorship Concerns, Business Owners, Partnership Firms, Public and Private Limited Companies, Government Organizations, Corporations, Clubs, Societies, NGOs etc.

question: Can I purchase Bancassurance policy from my account maintained with NUST Bank?
answer: Yes, every customer who attain the age of 18 and have account with NUST Bank can eligible to purchase Bancassurance policy from his account.

question: Which insurance providers offer Bancassurance through NUST Bank?
answer: Bancassurance is offered by following three Insurance Provider companies: NUST Life Assurance Company Ltd, EFU Life Assurance Company Ltd, Jubilee Life Insurance Company Ltd.

question: What are the main features of EFU Bancassurance Policy?
answer: Family Protection and Long term savings, Minimum Policy Amount = 18,000 No Maximum Limit of policy, Minimum Policy Term = 10 Years (Except Single Premium Plan), Additional benefits also available on cost (Riders and additional term insurance), EFU Life offer different plans to customer as per needs and demands of customers

question: How many EFU Insurance Plans are available?
answer: EFU Savings and Protection Plan 18K, EFU Education and Marriage Plan 18K, EFU Retirement Plan 18K, EFU - Single Premium Plan 100K, EFU Aggressive Growth Plan 250K

question: Does NUST Bank offer a Digital Banking Account for Freelancers?
answer: NUST Freelancer Digital Account is exclusively designed for Freelancers, so that they can receive their payments directly in a bank account and enjoy other lifestyle banking services as well.

question: What is the Account type of NUST Freelancer Digital Account? Is it Current or Saving?
answer: NUST Freelancer Digital Account offered Current Account in PKR & FCY (USD, GBP, EUR, AED)

question: What are the free benefits of NUST Freelancer Digital Account?
answer: Free Issuance of First Cheque book (25 Leaves)*, Free First Issuance of Visa Debit Card*, Free First Cheque Book & Debit Card Delivery*, Free SMS alerts facility (Digital Transactions), Free accidental Death & Disability Insurance/Takaful up to PKR 2.5 mn on monthly average balance of PKR 100,000

question: Are there any Credit and Debit limits in NUST Freelancer Digital Account?
answer: The following Transaction limits apply: Maximum Credit Balance Limit USD 5,000 or equivalent, Monthly Debit Limit USD 5,000 or equivalent, Cash Withdrawal Limit PKR 500,000 or equivalent / per day

question: What is the Target Market for NUST Freelancer Digital Account?
answer: Individuals running a freelance service business

question: What is Home Remittance?
answer: Home Remittance Service enables remitters to send money from abroad to Pakistan instantly, conveniently, and safely through the legal banking channel.

question: What types of Inward Home Remittance products does NUST Bank offer?
answer: NUST offers the following Home Remittance Products: Cash Over the Counter (CoC) payments for walk-in customers, NUST Account Transfer, Other Bank Account Transfer via Inter Bank Funds Transfer (IBFT) & Real Time Gross Settlement (RTGS)

question: In which currency will I receive my remittance?
answer: All home remittance payments are disbursed in Pak Rupees.

question: Is there any limit on the amount received though NUST Home Remittance?
answer: Below are the applicable limits: NUST Accounts - No Limit, Other banks accounts - No Limit, Cash Over the Counter (CoC) Transactions - Up to PKR 1,000,000/- per transaction and there is no limit of Western Union COC transactions

question: Are there any charges/fee for NUST's Home Remittance Service?
answer: NUST Home Remittance Service is free of charge.

question: Are there any tax deductions on Home Remittances?
answer: Home Remittance Service is free of taxes.

question: Can I receive remittance in Pakistan if I do not have a bank account with any bank?
answer: You can receive your home remittance from any of NUST 600+ domestic branches nationwide if you have a valid CNIC and Transaction Unique Reference No. / Pin

question: Is there any list of branches I can access to get information?
answer: The list of NUST domestic branches can be viewed from the Branch Locator available on our corporate website www.nustbank.com. https://NUSTbank.com/find-us/

question: Who should I contact in case I need to lodge a complaint regarding Home Remittance?
answer: For any query/complaint regarding Home Remittance, you may contact our dedicated Remittance Service Centre at UAN# 021-111-000-787. You may also email your queries/complaints at remittance@NUSTbank.com.pk

question: How can I obtain a Proceed Realization Certificate (PRC)/Encashment Certificate against remittance(s) received?
answer: e-PRC option is available at the NUST website https://secureportal.NUSTbank.com/eprc/customer to obtain a system generated PRC on your registered email address. Proceeds Realization Certificate (PRC) is issued from NUST Centralized Remittance Department. You may contact them at remittance.prc@NUSTbank.com.pk

question: Can I track my remittance status online?
answer: Yes, you can view the status of your remittance online through NUST Remittance Tracker by following link https://NUSTbank.com/services/alternate-deliverychannels/home-remittance-tracking/

question: What are NUST's Banking hours to avail home remittance services from NUST Branches?
answer: Customers can avail home remittance services from NUST domestic branches during regular business hours: Monday to Thursday: 09:00 am to 05:00 pm, Friday: 09:00 am to 05:30 pm, Saturday: 09:00 am to 01:30 pm (through selected branches)

question: Is it important to declare the purpose of the funds being sent to Pakistan?
answer: Yes, it is mandatory to provide purpose of funds being sent to Pakistan.

question: I am a foreign national, can I send money to Pakistan?
answer: Yes, you can.

question: Does the PRI comes under the laws of State Bank or Government?
answer: It is a joint initiative of State Bank of Pakistan, Ministry of overseas Pakistanis and Ministry of Finance.

question: Can the Freelance payment be made through PRI?
answer: Yes Freelance payments is allowed under specific arrangements with Tie-ups with allowed purposes as per SBP guidelines.

question: Can remittance be sent from anywhere to Pakistan?
answer: Yes, remittance can be sent from around the globe to Pakistan through our agent Partners like Western Union, Mastercard, Dandelion Payments (RIA) etc.

question: What conversion rates will be applied on remittance?
answer: The same conversion rates will be applied at the time of sending the remittance. Affiliated bank or Exchange Company confirm the Conversion rates to Sender at the time of sending the remittance.

question: Does NUST Bank has specialized remittance Account as per SBP guideline?
answer: Yes NUST has remittance account name as Pak Wattan Remittance Account.

question: Who can open Pak Wattan Remittance Account?
answer: A Bonafide recipient of Home remittance (PRI) can open this account.

question: What are the main features of JLI Bancassurance Policy?
answer: Short term Family Protection and in Long term Savings, Minimum Policy Amount = 18,000 No Maximum Limit of policy, Minimum Policy Term = 10 Years, Additional benefits also available on cost (Riders and additional term insurance), Jubilee Life offer different plans to customer as per needs and demands of customers

question: How many Jubilee Life Insurance Plans available?
answer: Jubilee Life Savings and Protection Plan 18K, Jubilee Life Education Plan 18K, Jubilee Life Marriage Plan 18K, Jubilee Life Retirement Plan 18K

question: What are the main features of these Jubilee Life Insurance Plans?
answer: 14 Days Free Look Period start from the day customer received Policy Documents, Unit Link growth system (JLI allocate Mutual fund units to customer, policy growth depends on the unit rate growth just like share Market), NUST bank is only act as a Corporate Sales Agent, In case of early termination, only Cash Value of policy will be payable to customer, Cancellation of policy and full refund option is available if policy documents returned during Free Lookup Period i.e. 14 days of receipt of documents, Cash Values of policy may be differ from the tentative returns provided on illustration document

question: I would like to open an account with my son, do u have any product for kids?
answer: Yes our product is Little Champs Account. It is designed specifically for minors (individuals below the age of 18 years). A child requires the help of a parental/legal guardian to open this account and avail its facilities. Little Champs get a Debit Card and chequebook which is free the first time

question: What are the main Features of the Little Champs Account?
answer: Minimum initial deposit of Rs.100/-, Free first chequebook (for Current Account only), Free debit card (annual/replacement fees apply)

question: What is the account type of Little Champs Account is it saving or current?
answer: This account is offered both in current and savings categories

question: What other Value added features does the Little Champs Account have?
answer: Attractive returns on savings account, SMS alert service on digital transactions, I Net banking services, Free education insurance plan – Rs.5,000/- per month for 5 years on savings account & Rs.10,000 per month for 5 years on current account in case of death of the guardian

question: How can the minor operate this account?
answer: This account is opened in the name of the minor. However, a minor needs a guardian's help to avail the account's facilities. A minor can use the account any time – which means he or she can make deposits or take money out at any time with the guardian's help.

question: What documents are required to open a Little Champs Account?
answer: A photocopy of Form-B, Birth Certificate or Student ID card (as appropriate) of the minor. A photocopy of valid identity document of the guardian of the minor such as CNIC, NICOP, POC, ARC, or Passport with valid visa. Source of income of guardian.

question: What are the debit card limits for Little Champs Account?
answer: Daily funds Transfer Limit: Rs.100,000/-, Daily ATM Withdrawal Limit: Rs.25,000/-, Daily POS Limit: Rs.50,000/-

question: What is the profit rate and payment frequency for Little Champs Savings Account?
answer: Profit Payment is Semi-Annually with Profit Rate of 19.00%

question: What is the Eligibility Criteria for NAA?
answer: Resident Pakistani individuals who do not maintain/have any other account (single or joint) in NUST Bank Limited are eligible to open the NAA in Pak rupees as a single/joint account.

question: What are the basic Features of NUST Asaan Account?
answer: Bi-annual account statements, No service charges for account opening & closing, Free PayPak Debit Card issuance (subsequent charges apply as per the prevailing Schedule of Charges), Free SMS Alerts on digital transaction, Free E-statements, Free I-Net banking / Mobile Banking, Free Inter Branch Online Cash Withdrawal/ Deposit (Online), Free Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer), Transaction limit is Rs. 1,000,000/- for total credit balance and total debit per month, Cross border (outward) transactions shall not be allowed except in case of international transactions carried out through debit cards, Customers can place their funds in Bank's prescribed TDR products.

question: What is the Profit rate on NAA Savings account?
answer: Current profit rate is 20.50% which is paid Semi Annually.

question: What is the account type of NAA?
answer: NAA can be opened both in Current & Savings

question: What is the opening and minimum balance requirement in NAA?
answer: Account can be opened with Rs.100/ and there is No minimum balance requirement.

question: Is NUST Bank offering a simple Digital Banking Account?
answer: Yes, NUST Asaan Digital Account is being offered

question: What is the Target Market of NUST Asaan Digital Account?
answer: NUST Asaan Digital Account is specially designed for unbanked / under-banked customer segments. This account is most suited for but not limited to skilled/unskilled workforce

question: What is the Account type of NUST Asaan Digital Account? is it Current or Saving?
answer: NUST Asaan Digital account is a Current Account in PKR currency

question: What are the free benefits of NUST Asaan Digital Account?
answer: Free Issuance of First Cheque book (25 Leaves), Free First Issuance of PayPak Debit Card, Free First Cheque Book & Debit Card Delivery, Free SMS alerts facility (Digital Transactions), Free E-statement & I-Net Banking, Free Inter Branch Online Cash Deposit/Withdrawal (Online), Free Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer), Free Banker's Cheque Issuance

question: Who is eligible for this account?
answer: Skilled/Unskilled Workforce, Less Educated/Uneducated People, Farmers, Laborers/Daily Wagers, Women/Housewives, Self-Employed Individuals, Young Adults

question: Is there a Monthly Transaction Limit (Debit and Credit Limit) in NUST Asaan Digital Account?
answer: Maximum Credit Balance Limit PKR 1,000,000/-, Monthly Debit Limit PKR 1,000,000/-

question: I would like to inquire about opening of a Digital Remittance Account, Please tell me what options are available?
answer: NUST Asaan Digital Remittance Account is specially designed for Pakistani Resident Individuals who wish to receive remittances from their families and friends living abroad, directly in a bank account without the hassle of visiting the branch.

question: What is the Account type of NUST Asaan Digital Remittance Account? is it Current or Saving?
answer: NUST Asaan Digital Remittance account is a Current Account in PKR currency

question: What are the free benefits of NUST Asaan Digital Remittance Account?
answer: Free Issuance of First Cheque book (25 Leaves), Free First Issuance of PayPak Debit Card, Free First Cheque Book & Debit Card Delivery, Free SMS alerts facility (Digital Transactions), Free E-statement & I-Net Banking, Free Inter Branch Online Cash Deposit/Withdrawal (Online), Free Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer), Free Banker's Cheque Issuance, Free accidental Death & Disability Insurance/Takaful up to PKR 2.5 mn on monthly average balance of PKR 100,000

question: What is the Target Market?
answer: Individuals- Beneficiaries (families) of Pakistanis working abroad

question: Are there any transaction limits in NUST Asaan Digital Remittance Account?
answer: The following Transaction limits apply: Maximum Credit Balance Limit PKR 3,000,000, Cash Withdrawal Limit PKR 500,000/ per day, Fund Transfer Limit PKR 500,000/ per day, Local Credit Limit PKR 1,000,000/ per day

question: Is NUST Bank offering any financing against liquid security?
answer: NUST Fauri Business Finance has been introduced to provide a swift package to meet financial business needs of new to bank obligor. AFBF is offered to meet short, medium and long-term requirements of business. The finance will be provided to SMEs & Commercial for all the eligible sectors as per NUST credit policy manual.

question: What is the Eligibility Criteria for business entity in Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: All except individuals

question: Is there any business age requirement?
answer: No

question: What is the nature of financing offered under Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: AFBF-1: Running Finance, AFBF-2: Term Loan, AFBF-3: Letter of Guarantee, AFBF-4: Letter of Credit – Sight / Usance

question: What is the current Mark-up rate of Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: AFBF-1: 3MK /COD +1.50%, AFBF-2: 12 MK /COD +2.0%, AFBF-3: As per SOC, AFBF-4: As per SOC

question: What is the principal repayment frequency in Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: AFBF-1: At Maturity, AFBF-2: Monthly / Quarterly, AFBF-3: Upon expiry / redemption, AFBF-4: Upon retirement

question: What is the markup repayment frequency in Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: AFBF-1: Monthly / Quarterly, AFBF-2: Monthly / Quarterly, AFBF-3: Upfront, AFBF-4: Upfront

question: What is the maximum tenure of Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: AFBF-1: Up to 1 Year, AFBF-2: Up to 3 Year, AFBF-3: Up to 30 Months, AFBF-4: At Sight / Usance period 120 days

question: What are the Loan Limits of Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: Max Rs. 200 Mn (For all products)

question: Is there any grace period allowed in any financing?
answer: Grace period of 3 months allowed for AFBF 2 (Term Loan Only)

question: What are the service/documentation/legal charges in Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: At actual

question: Is there any premature termination / Balloon payment charges?
answer: Nil

question: In how many days the loan can be approved in Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: Turnaround time (TAT) for disposal off the approval is fixed to 03 days from the date of pre-approval completion of documents

question: What is the collateral requirement for Ask Fauri Business Finance?
answer: NUST: Lien on NUST deposit CA/SA/ TDR, including 3rd party (LCY/FCY), National Saving Certificates (NSC): (Lien over NSC including joint name/owner)

question: What are the processing charges for Ask Fauri Finance Application?
answer: Flat @ Rs. 3,000/- (at the time of initiating and on each renewal)

question: Does NUST Bank offer a Digital Banking Account for Freelancers?
answer: NUST Freelancer Digital Account is exclusively designed for Freelancers, so that they can receive their payments directly in a bank account and enjoy other lifestyle banking services as well.

question: What is the Account type of NUST Freelancer Digital Account? is it Current or Saving?
answer: NUST Freelancer Digital Account offered Current Account in PKR & FCY (USD, GBP, EUR, AED)

question: What are the free benefits of NUST Freelancer Digital Account?
answer: Free Issuance of First Cheque book (10 Leaves), Free First Issuance of UnionPay Debit Card, Free First Cheque Book & Debit Card Delivery, Free SMS alerts facility (Digital Transactions), Free accidental Death & Disability Insurance/Takaful up to PKR 2.5 mn on monthly average balance of PKR 100,000

question: Are there any Credit and Debit limits in NUST Freelancer Digital Account?
answer: The following Transaction limits apply: Maximum Credit Balance Limit USD 5,000 or equivalent, Monthly Debit Limit USD 5,000 or equivalent, Cash Withdrawal Limit PKR 500,000 or equivalent / per day

question: What is the Target Market?
answer: Individuals running a freelance service business

question: Is NUST Bank offering any seasonal financing?
answer: Seasonal finance product 'NUST Flour Mill Finance' has been structured through for quick financing under program-based lending. The product has been designed for Flour Mills in order to meet their working capital needs. NUST Flour Mill Finance caters to meet seasonal financing needs of wheat procurement and other overhead expenses to flour mills. The scope of product is to target flour mills which fall under category of SME.

question: For which purposes NUST Flour Mill Finance is being offered?
answer: Cash Finance (CF): To meet working capital requirements of flour mill business for procurement of wheat as per milling capacity. Running Finance (RF): To meet working capital requirements i.e. transportation, salary & wages, utility and other administrative expenses etc. (Procurement of wheat through RF funds is restricted)

question: What are the Loan Limits of NUST Flour Mill Finance?
answer: Per party (single entity) can avail up to Rs. 75M for ME and Rs. 25M for SE

question: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Flour Mill Finance?
answer: Age of borrower (in case of sole-proprietorship) must be minimum 20 years, however age not to exceed 65 years at the time of application. This age can be relaxed in case of effective succession planning for business operations. This criteria is not applicable, if business concern is a partnership or limited company

question: What is the maximum tenure of NUST Flour Mill Finance?
answer: Maximum 1 year as per clean-up corridors

question: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Flour Mill Finance?
answer: Cash Finance: 3 Months average KIBOR + 3% p.a. Running Finance: 3 Months average KIBOR + 3.5% p.a. (reviewed/revised on quarterly basis)

question: Any Account turnover requirement for NUST Flour Mill Finance?
answer: Minimum 50% of applicant's sales to be documented through account turnover with bank(s).

question: What are the processing charges for NUST Flour Mill Finance Application?
answer: Processing fee will be charged @ 0.15% of total limit(s) processed/approved or Rs. 25,000/- whichever is higher

question: What are the service/documentation/legal charges in NUST Flour Mill Finance?
answer: At actual

question: What are the insurance charges?
answer: At actual

question: Is there any business loan product offered by NUST for families of armed forces and retired officers of the armed forces?
answer: NUST Hunarmand Finance is a sub product of PMYB&ALS which is structured with an objective to provide business opportunity to specific target market.

question: Who can apply for NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: Retired commissioned, junior commissioned, non-commissioned officers of the armed forces and their family members i.e. spouse and children. Spouse and children of serving commissioned, junior commissioned and non-commissioned officers of armed forces.

question: For which purposes NUST Hunarmand Finance is being offered?
answer: To start new business. To expand existing business.

question: Nature of loan allowed in NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: Long term / Development Loans. Working capital / Production Loans.

question: What are the Loan Limits of NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: Tier 2: Above Rs. 0.5M and up to Rs 1.5M. Tier 3: Above Rs 1.5 M and up to Rs 7.5M

question: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: All Pakistanis aged between 21 and 45 are eligible to apply, however for IT/E-Commerce related businesses, the lower age limit will be 18 years

question: What is the maximum tenure in NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: Long Term Loan: Maximum 8 Years (Maximum 1 Year Grace Period). Working Capital Loan: Maximum 05 Years (Maximum 2 Year Grace Period). Markup will be recovered during grace period

question: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: Tier 2: 4.5% per annum. Tier 3: 6.5% per annum

question: Does the bank require any Equity for this scheme?
answer: Tier 2: 10% (New Business). Tier 3: 20% (New Business). In case of existing business, equity is not required

question: Are there any late payment charges?
answer: Late payment charges PKR 1,000/- plus FED will be charges after 30th day of installment overdue.

question: What are the charges applicable for NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: Applicable as per PMYB & ALS

question: What is the security requirement for availing NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: Personal guarantee of borrower for loans up to 1.5M, and direct debit authority of borrower/pensioner/guarantor to be obtained. For loans above 1.5M, it shall be secured against movable as well as immovable assets of borrowers as defined under PMYB&ALs. Guarantee of serving officer of armed forces in case of his family (spouse or children) avail loan under this program.

question: What is the repayment frequency in NUST Hunarmand Finance?
answer: Repayment of AHF loans will be made in the form of monthly or quarterly Instalments (or as per SBP's directives)

question: Is NUST Bank offering any financing specifically for the ownership & capacity enhancement of business premises?
answer: NUST Bank has structured a new financing product 'NUST Imarat Finance' under the ambit of SME segment. The Product Program has been developed in order to stabilize SME business through making their ownership of business premises (under mortgage finance of urban commercial / industrial buildings) for capacity enhancement of SMEs. The product has been structured for SMEs owned by general public as well as retired armed forces officers and families of serving officers.

question: For which purpose NUST Imarat Finance is being offered?
answer: AIF 1: Acquisition / Purchase of urban commercial / industrial construted property/ office and commercial premises for commercial / business activity. AIF 2: Construction on self owned urban commercial / Industrial plot. AIF 3: Additional construction on already built urban commercial/ industrial plaza/building. AIF 4: Renovation of self owned urban commercial /industrial property/Plaza/ business premises

question: What are the Loan Limits of NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: AIF 1: Mininum Rs. 5.00 M & Maximum Rs. 100M. AIF 2: Mininum Rs. 5.00 M & Maximum Rs. 50M. AIF 3: Maximum Rs. 30M or upto 30% of FSV of offered property, whichever is lower. AIF 4: Maximum Rs. 5M or upto 25% of FSV of offered property, whichever is lower

question: What is the maximum tenure of NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: AIF 1: Maximum 10 Years (Grace Period upto 6 months). AIF 2: Maximum 10 Years(Grace Period upto 9 months). AIF 3: Maximum 8 Years (Grace Period upto 6 months). AIF 4: Maximum 03 Years (Grace Period upto 3 months). (markup to be recovered during grace period)

question: Does the bank require any Equity for this scheme?
answer: AIF 1 & AIF 2: Minimum 30% (Existing business) & Minimum 40% (New Business). AIF 3 & AIF 4: Nil for Existing business & Minimum 25% (New Business)

question: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: New Business: Minimum 30 years at the time of application, however age not to exceed 60 years at maturity of loan. Existing Business: Minimum 30 years at the time of application however age not to exceed 65 years at maturity of loan.

question: Any mandatory qualification/experience required?
answer: Specifically for New Business: Graduation/14 years education OR minimum 5 years business experience in same field. No Professional Qualification Required for existing business

question: What is the current Mark-up rate of NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: General Regular SME's End-user Rate: 12MK+4% p.a. (to be reviewed on annual basis). SME's Backed By Armed Forces End-user Rate: 12MK+2.5 p.a. (to be reviewed on annual basis)

question: Is there any business age requirement?
answer: Existing Business Minimum 03 year operating history of business

question: What should be the legal structure of business for availing NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: Sole Proprietor, Partnership Firm(registered), Private Limited Company, Limited Company

question: What is the security requirement for availing NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: Effective Mortgage (Equitable / or token registered) to be created on same urban Commercial / Industrial property which has been financed. 03 post dated cheques of the full loan amount plus markup. Personal Guarantees from borrowers, all partners and directors of the companies alongwith 'Personal Net worth Statement'. Fard based property to be registered equivalent to the full loan amount

question: What is the repayment frequency in NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: Monthly/Quarterly

question: Is there any condition related to bank account maintenance for availing NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: Minimum 01 year bank account statement with NUST

question: Is there any penalty charges related to Premature termination/balloon payment penalties?
answer: In case entire outstanding loan is adjusted within 03 years of first disbursement: At 3% of the total outstanding loan amount (General Category), At 2% of the total outstanding loan amount (Armed Forces Category). In case entire outstanding loan is adjusted after 03 years: At 2% of the total outstanding loan amount (General Category), At 1% of the total outstanding loan amount (Armed Forces Category). Balloon Payment upto 20% of loan outstanding amount is allowed once in each year without penalty. Adjustment of over and above 20% will be charged @ 2% of balloon payment Amount (General Category). Balloon payment upto 30% of loan outstanding amount is allowed once in each year without penalty. Adjustment of over and above 30% will be charged @1% of balloon payment amount (Armed Forces Category)

question: What are the processing charges for NUST Imarat Finance Application?
answer: Rs 30,000/- or 0.2% of loan amount whichever is higher (Non-refundable)

question: Are there any late payment charges?
answer: Rs. 3,000/- per installment

question: What are the service/documentation/legal charges in NUST Imarat Finance?
answer: At actual

question: What are the valuation/BOQ charges?
answer: At actual

question: Does NUST Bank offer Any account for Non-Resident Pakistanis (NRPs)?
answer: Yes Roshan Digital Account. Specially Designed for Individual Non-Resident Pakistanis (NRPs) seeking to undertake banking, payment and investment activities in Pakistan.

question: Is there any minimum balance requirement of Roshan Digital Account?
answer: No initial deposit requirement, No minimum balance requirement

question: What are the main features of the Roshan Digital Account?
answer: Offered in PKR and USD/GBP/EUR, SMS Alerts on registered local and International numbers, Bill Payments & Funds Transfer within Pakistan via Local ATMs & Internet Banking, Investment in Naya Pakistan Certificates, Real Estate, NUST Term Deposits Receipts and Stock Market. Note: Local Deposits are not allowed in RDA

question: What are the free facilities?
answer: Free First Issuance of Debit Card- Annual charges as per prevailing SOC, Free I-Net banking, Free E-statements

question: How to apply for Roshan Digital Account?
answer: Customer can visit NUST Bank's website and click on 'Apply for Roshan Digital Account' to open NUST Roshan Digital Account. Customer would complete the Account Opening Form and submit the required documents. Customer request to open Roshan Digital Account will be processed in 48 working hours. In case of any discrepancy or requirement of additional information, the bank will contact the customer accordingly as per provided contact details.

question: What is the NUST Bank Web Portal Link for RDA?
answer: https://secureportal.NUSTbank.com/rda/

question: What are the charges and tax implications for RDA?
answer: All bank charges are applicable as per prevailing Schedule of Charges. Zakat and WHT taxes on profit are not applicable on RDA account

question: Who can open a Roshan Digital Account?
answer: NRPs, OPF Members, Foreign Nationals having Pakistan Origin Card (POC), Pakistani Nationals having declared Assets abroad, Govt. Employees & Officials posted abroad

question: What is the profit payment frequency for Roshan Digital Account?
answer: Monthly

question: What is the profit rate for Roshan Digital Account?
I would like to inquire about opening a current account for business purpose with your Bank. Please tell me what options I have?
answer: NUST Value Premium Business Account has been designed to better meet the specialized banking needs of businesses that continue to grow with time.

question: Please tell me about Free Facilities being provided on Value Plus Current Account for Premium Business upon maintaining minimum Monthly average Balance?
answer: Issuance of Cheque Books, Duplicate Account Statement, Issuance of Debit Card, Internet Banking facility, SMS Alerts on Digital Transaction, Same Day & Intercity Cheque Deposit, E-statement, Inter Branch Online Cash Deposit/Withdrawal (Online), Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer), Speedy processing of Financing, Banker's Cheque Issuance Free LC / LG issuance (Cash backed or Account lien based). Subsequent Charges/Annual Fees would be as per prevailing SOC

question: Please tell me about the Minimum Monthly balance required for this account?
answer: No initial deposit requirement, Rs. 100,000/- (Monthly Average Balance)

question: What other benefits do I get from using a VPBA?
answer: Customized Salary Processing & Cash Management solutions ACMS (Internet Banking solution for Corporate Clients), ATM Cash Withdrawal Insurance

question: What is the Target Market for Value Plus Premium Business Account?
answer: Medium Enterprises, Partnership Firms, Private & Public Limited Companies, Corporate & Commercial Organizations, NGOs / NPOs / Trust/ Charitable Organizations

question: I would like to inquire about opening a current account for business with your Bank. Please tell me what options I have?
answer: NUST Value Plus Business Account is best suited for startups and businesses

question: Please tell me about Free Facilities being provided on Value Plus Current Account for Business upon maintaining minimum Monthly average Balance?
answer: Issuance of Cheque Books, Duplicate Account Statement, Issuance of Debit Card, Internet Banking facility, SMS Alerts on Digital Transaction, E-statement, Inter Branch Online Cash Deposit/Withdrawal (Online), Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer), Banker's Cheque Issuance. Subsequent Charges/Annual Fees would be as per prevailing SOC

question: Please tell me about minimum Monthly balance required?
answer: No initial deposit requirement, Rs. 25,000/- (Monthly Average Balance)

question: What is Target Market for Value Plus Business Account?
answer: Sole Proprietors, General Partnership, Small Enterprises

question: Is there any insurance coverage available?
answer: ATM Cash Withdrawal Insurance

question: I would like to inquire about opening a current account for Individuals with your Bank. Please tell me what options I have?
answer: NUST Value Plus Current Account is specially designed for individuals to cater their financial needs.

question: What are the free facilities being provided with NUST Value Plus Current Account?
answer: Cheque Books (unlimited), Debit Card (First is free), 2 Supplementary Debit Cards, Duplicate Account Statements, On-line Fund Transfer Facility, Free SMS alerts facility on Digital Transactions, Free E-statement & I-Net Banking, Free Inter Branch Online Cash Deposit/Withdrawal (Online), Free Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer), Allocation of Lockers (upon availability), Free Banker's Cheque Issuance. Subsequent Charges/Annual Fees would be as per prevailing SOC. Locker availability on maintaining a minimum monthly average balance of Rs. 50,000

question: Are there any insurance benefits associated with VPCA?
answer: ATM Cash Withdrawal Insurance Coverage, 24 Hours World-wide 'Accidental Death & Permanent Disability' Insurance Coverage

question: What is the opening and minimum balance requirement for VPCA?
answer: No Opening Balance Requirements, No Minimum Monthly Average Balance Requirements

question: Who can apply for NUST Personal Finance?
answer: 1. Armed Forces Officers (Serving employees, Retired employees), 2. JCOs/Equivalent & Lower Cadres (Serving employees, Retired employees), 3. Allied Armed Forces (SPD & its allied concerns) and Civilians (in GHQ/NHQ & AHQ) (Serving employees - Permanent & Contractual), 4. Fauji Foundation Group (Permanent employees, Contractual employees), 5. Salaried Individuals (Permanent employees, Contractual employees), 6. GOP / Semi Government / Autonomous Bodies (Permanent employees, Contractual employees, Retired employees), 7. NUST Employees (governed under HR Policy)

question: Can overseas Pakistanis obtain Personal Finance facility from NUST?
answer: No, the availability of applicants & their employers is mandatory within Pakistan for applying clean Personal Finance.

question: What is the minimum and maximum financing amount?
answer: The minimum financing amount is Rs. 50,000/ (Rs. 35,000 for retired JCOs & Lower Cadre - Subject to pension with NUST). Maximum finance up to Rs. 3,000,000 (For non-prime customers) and up to Rs. 4,000,000 (For prime customers). Whereas maximum finance amount depends on case to case basis subject to income multiples within 40% Debt Burden Ratio or limit as defined in the PPM Personal Finance. The maximum financing limit will be up to 40% Debt Burden Ratio and as per SBP PR.

question: What are the minimum & maximum financing tenures?
answer: Minimum 01 year, Maximum 04 years (up to 7 years for Education Loan) or as per prevailing SBP PRs.

question: What is the age criteria for applying NUST Personal Finance?
answer: Minimum: Salaried: 21 years (18 years for Armed Forces), SEB/SEP: 23 years, Prime Customers: 25 years. Maximum: Permanent: 60 years, Contractual: 65 years, Pensioners: 65 years (70 Years for Armed Forces), SEB/SEP: 65 years at the time of loan Maturity

question: What is the minimum monthly income criterion?
answer: Salaried (Approved Company): Category A Company - PKR 40,000 (Permanent) & PKR 60,000 (Company / 3rd Party Contractual), Category B & C Company - PKR 50,000 (Permanent) & PKR 60,000 (Company / 3rd Party Contractual). Salaried (Non-approved Company): PKR 70,000 (Permanent) & PKR 80,000 (Company Contractual). Salaried (GOP): Serving - PKR 35,000 (Permanent, BPS-5 & above) & PKR 45,000 (Contractual), Retired - PKR 40,000 subject to pension with NUST. Armed Forces, Allied Concerns & Civilians in GHQ/NHQ/AHQ: Serving - PKR 25,000 (Commissioned Officers / JCOs & Lower Cadre), Retired - PKR 40,000 (Commissioned Officers) and Rs. 15,000 (JCOs & Lower Cadre subject to pension with NUST), SPD & its allied concerns - PKR 25,000 (Permanent & Contractual), Civilians in GHQ/NHQ/AHQ - PKR 25,000 (Permanent) and PKR 35,000 (Contractual). Fauji Foundation & its Allied Concerns: PKR 25,000 (Permanent & Contractual). SEB/SEP: PKR 100,000 (Branch Customers), PKR 150,000 (Non-Branch Customers)

question: In which area of the country one can avail Personal Finance form NUST?
answer: Personal Finance can be availed from all cities where NUST branches exists.

question: What is the Application processing time?
answer: The processing time of Personal Finance is 10 working days form login till approval (subject to complete application with required documents).

question: What is the Application processing Charges?
answer: It will be as per prevailing Schedule of Charges (SOC) or As per corporate arrangement.

question: What is the repayment mode?
answer: Payment of Equal Monthly Instalment (EMI) comprising of principal, mark-up and insurance payment will be made through Direct Debit Authority (DDA) of borrower's account maintained with NUST.

question: Can I make balloon payments or premature termination of facility?
answer: Yes, Balloon payment or premature termination option is available for all customers. Charges will be applied as per prevailing Bank's schedule of charges / As per corporate arrangement.

question: What happens if I fail to fulfil your payment obligations?
answer: In case of overdue / default, recovery department of NUST will contact you, your loan related details will be reported to Credit Bureau. Late payment will be applicable as per prevailing schedule of charges. Legal proceeding may also be initiated by the Bank.

question: How will I get update of my Personal Loan Application?
answer: You can visit/ call or send email at our Customer Services centre(s) as well. Email Address: CustomerServices@NUSTbank.com.pk

question: Is your bank offering Profit & Loss account?
answer: Yes, Profit & Loss Sharing Account is specially designed to meet the transactional and savings need of customers.

question: What are the main features of NUST Profit & Loss Sharing (PLS) Account?
answer: Offered in LCY (PKR) & FCY (USD, GBP, EUR, JPY & AED), Account opening deposit of Rs.100 for LCY, US $500 or equivalent for FCY, Debit Card Issuance against LCY account, Profit Calculation- Monthly Average Balance, Profit Payment Frequency- Semi-Annually

question: What are free features available with NUST Savings Profit & Loss Sharing (PLS) Account?
answer: Free E-statement & I-Net Banking, Free Inter Branch Online Cash Deposit/Withdrawal (Online), Free Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer), Free Banker's Cheque Issuance, Free SMS Alerts on Digital Transaction

question: What is the Target Market?
answer: Individuals (either singly or jointly), Proprietorship Concerns, Partnership Firms, Public and Private Limited Companies, Government Organizations, Corporations, Clubs, Societies, Associations, NGOs/NPOs/Charitable Organizations

question: What is the profit rate for PLS account?
answer: 19.00% for standard PLS account and 19.25% for PLS Pensioners Account

question: What is the profit payment frequency for PLS account?
answer: Semi-Annually

question: Is NUST Bank Participating in PMYB & ALS?
answer: NUST Bank is actively participating in PMYB&ALS. It has been specially designed to provide self-employment opportunity to the unemployed youth of the country who have skills, knowledge, experience or willingness to start their own businesses on small to medium scale or expand existing business on vast scale.

question: For which purposes PMYB & ALS is being offered?
answer: To start new business, To expand existing business

question: Nature of loans allowed in PMYB & ALS?
answer: Long term / Development Loans, Working capital / Production Loans

question: What are the Loan Limits of PMYB & ALS?
answer: Tier 2: Above Rs. 0.5M and up to Rs 1.5M, Tier 3: Above Rs 1.5 M and up to Rs 7.5M

question: Is there any minimum age to avail financing in PMYB & ALS and any mandatory qualification/experience required?
answer: All Pakistanis aged between 21 and 45 are eligible to apply, however for IT/E-Commerce related businesses, the lower age limit will be 18 years (at least matriculation or equivalent education will be required)

question: What is the maximum tenure in PMYB & ALS?
answer: Long Term Loan: Maximum 8 Years (Maximum 1 Year Grace Period), Working Capital Loan: Maximum 05 Years (Maximum 2 Year Grace Period), Markup will be recovered during grace period

question: What is the current Mark-up rate of PMYB & ALS?
answer: Tier 2: 5% per annum, Tier 3: 7% per annum

question: Does the bank require any Equity for this scheme?
answer: Tier 2: 10% (New Business), Tier 3: 20% (New Business), Existing Business: Nil

question: What is the repayment frequency in PMYB & ALS?
answer: Repayment of PMYB&ALS loans will be made in the form of monthly or quarterly Instalments (or as per SBP's directives)

question: What is the security requirement for availing PMYB & ALS?
answer: Tier 2: i. Clean; personal guarantee of the borrower, ii. 02 Post Dated cheques for installment amount, iii. 01 Post Dated cheque for full loan amount plus mark up as per amortization schedule. Tier 3: i. Mortgage of residential / commercial / industrial property owned by borrower or third party, ii. HPA on vehicle in the name of borrower or immediate family member i.e. parents, spouse, children, brothers or sisters, iii. Liquid security (lien on deposit, Saving certificates, TDRs etc.)

question: Is there any late payment charges?
answer: PKR 1,000/- plus FED per instance per installment, grace period included. (Late Payment to be triggered 15 days after installment becomes due i.e. on day 16)

question: Is there any quota for womens?
answer: 25% of the loans will go to women borrowers

question: What are the processing charges for PMYB & ALS?
What are the service/documentation/legal charges in PMYB & ALS?
answer: At actual

question: Is there any account NUST Bank is offering for remittance purposes?
answer: Yes PakWatan Remittance Account. Through the PakWatan Remittance Account, beneficiaries can quickly and securely receive remittances from their loved one living abroad directly into their bank account without visiting the branch.

question: What are initial/minimum balance requirements for PakWatan Remittance Account?
answer: No initial deposit requirement, No minimum balance requirement

question: Are Local Credits allowed in PakWatan Remittance Account?
answer: Local credits are also allowed in PakWatan Remittance Account

question: What are the free services associated with PakWatan Remittance account?
answer: Free services include: First Cheque Book of 25 Leaves (For Current Account only), NUST Visa Debit Card Issuance (annual and replacement fee would apply) (For Current Account only), Bankers Cheque Issuance, Inter Branch Online Cash Withdrawal/ Deposit (Online), Internal Fund Transfer within NUST via branch (Online Transfer), Internet Banking, SMS on digital transactions, E-statements

question: What is the profit rate offered on this account and when is credited?
answer: Profit payment on monthly basis based on monthly average balance, Profit Rate: Monthly 19.00%

question: Are there any other benefits to opening a PakWatan Remittance Account?
answer: WHT exemption on cash withdrawal on home remittances received from abroad, Customer may also be eligible for Personal Finance, Credit Cards and Auto Finance after six months of maintaining PakWatan Remittance Account, subject to eligibility criteria of the bank

question: Is there any Insurance Coverage for this account?
answer: ATM Cash Withdrawal Insurance coverage up to daily cash withdrawal limit of the debit card from NUST Bank ATMs, 24 hours world-wide 'Accidental Death & Permanent Disability' insurance coverage to Debit Card holders. Rs. 500,000/- and Rs. 700,000/- for Classic and Gold Debit Cards respectively, 24 hours world-wide 'Accidental Death & Permanent Disability' insurance coverage. The sum insured per account holder shall be equivalent to four times of the average balance completed in the last six months – maximum up to Rs. 2.5 million
